intro: Beloperone nemorosa, commonly known as the redroot false nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Beloperone nemorosa is often found in association with other shade-tolerant species in forest understories.
